comments:
Set the orm.xml file catalog element for a Table through the JPA Details view combo box.  Type in to the combo box a catalog that does not exist on the database.  The catalog is set correctly in the orm.xml file, but the following exception occurs:

java.util.NoSuchElementException
at org.eclipse.jpt.db.internal.ConnectionProfile.setCatalogName(ConnectionProfile.java:167)
at org.eclipse.jpt.ui.internal.mappings.details.CatalogCombo.setSpecifiedCatalog(CatalogCombo.java:168)
at org.eclipse.jpt.ui.internal.mappings.details.CatalogCombo.access$4(CatalogCombo.java:166)
at org.eclipse.jpt.ui.internal.mappings.details.CatalogCombo$3.modifyText(CatalogCombo.java:157)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TypedListener.handleEvent(TypedListener.java:166)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:66)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:938)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:962)
Fixed, only accept catalog name listed in the combo box.
